I'm a little broad of shoulder, and so it fit a bit snug in my shoulder/chest area (I wear a 32 C). The bottom portion of the costume (the crotch area) was a bit baggy (I wear a size 4/ 6 in jeans). However, it did fit over my bottom without showing cheek. The tail was flat but it was be easily remedied by stuffing it with cotton. Overall, I liked the costume and was satisfied with it.

reviewText: I got this for carrying to classes where I might need to haul some supplies that wouldn't fit in my tool box, as well as for things like the farmers market and traveling. It is not as good quality overall as the last one I purchased, the Cameron Crossbody. The material is thinner and the leather straps are not fabric backed and feel brittle and like they won't hold up long. The cross on the front is the same color as the straps, not reddish like I thought, which is no big deal but ads to a cheaper look. There are little pickets inside but they are too narrow and deep to be much use for holding say a smartphone or a pack of cigarettes or a lip balm...too annoying to fish small things out, too skinny to fit larger things. They'd probably hold your sunglasses and maybe headphones. There is also a zipper pocket, and the top zips which is useful. It's a cute bag, definitely unique looking, and I will keep it and use it for what I bought it for as long as it lasts. But for over fifty dollars, if I'd seen it in person in a store and felt the material no way would I have spent that for it.
summary: Not As Nice As the Last Mona B Bag I Bought

reviewText:
Let me be frank, this thing is an embarrassment to bondage. It's ill-fitting, poorly conceived, the closures don't like staying closed, and it's too loose over the arm and binds badly on the underarm. The leather is stiff and chemically, hoping this does not cause a formaldehyde rash.
It's cheap, you get what you pay for. It might work if you're corralling twinks, but that's about it. It's not even very ornamental, and uncomfortable through the yoke and under the pectorals, so if you wind up buying it, exercise extreme caution about breathing.

P.s. Looks very little like the display image. Much less generous with the leather.

reviewText:
This is a simple backpack that looked really small when I got it in the package but it expands nicely to hold a good amount.

Pic #1 = The backpack with two soda cans, one in each side bottle holder. I appreciated the webbing is a little larger, so it wasn't a really tight fit for the can, but can hold a slightly larger water bottle too. Perfect!

Pic #2 = In the main pouch I have my 15-inch laptop, my 10-inch tablet w/case, two(2) trade paperback books, two(2) mice in the extra zipper pocket, plus a full bag of sunflower seeds. There is still lots of room to add more items in the main part of the bag. Awesome!

Pic #3 = Rear pocket. You can fit an 8-inch tablet in this pocket or other knick-nacks. It's a good size too.

Pic #4 = The middle pocket is thinner than the main pocket but longer than the rear pocket. I have a camera, pockets for other things, and my 10-inch tablet again. The pocket is deep and is great for a notebook for school.

Pic #5 = another view of the main pocket down to the bottom. You can see it spread out to allow for a couple of thick text books, in addition to the laptop pocket on the left of the picture.

Pic #6 = Zippers have double-stitching and a nice glowy pull string on the end end of the zipper. The nice long pull strings make it easier to open and close the zippers.

Pic #7 = Front has the breathable material between your back and the backpack. Also two molle, one on each strap if you want to hang items from it or find another connector to strap across your chest.

Pic #8 = Top handle, so you can carry this when it's not feasible to sling it over your back/shoulders.

Pic #9 = The handle and straps have extra thick sewing on the inside holding it and the backpack together. I appreciate the extra effort to ensure these items don't split easily. Thank you!

Pic #10 = Buckles have extra stitching on the strap too, especially if one is pulling to tighten and release the strap. Good job!

Pic #11 = I laid the backpack down in a small puddle for 5 minutes to test if it is in fact waterproof.
I had a paper towel in each compartment. They were all dry except where I had the zipper was exposed, as there isn't a fold over flap for the middle and rear pockets like the main compartment has a flap. Thus some moisture seeped in. It's enough protection going between classes that your stuff will stay dry in these two other pockets, but having the extra material flap over the zipper on all pockets would be an area of improvement. Otherwise, there is a 'plastic' barrier lining the inside of the pockets and bottom, making this in fact fairly waterproof, not just water resistant. Though it would not hurt to spray this pack with some water resistant spray, just in case. Impressive!

OVERALL: It's a simple backpack that holds more than it looks, has great attention to the stitching and zippers and will save your equipment if you get caught in the rain.

Disclaimer: I received this product free or at a discounted price, in exchange for the purposes of a product review. All opinions are 100% my own and they reflect my honest & unbiased opinion. Your experience may differ from mine.
summary: Deceivingly small...it holds a lot more than it looks

reviewText: I received this product as a free sample. Nonetheless, this honest and unbiased review is a result of my own product testing and research. This bag just announces one thing: simplicity. It does very few things very well, and I truly appreciate that in a bag. As someone who carries my things with me every day in a backpack, I know that I don't need tons of extra straps, pouches, and pockets within pockets. With this backpack, you get three compartments: the small front pouch, the medium pocket with many slots and compartments, and then the main pouch. Yes, this backpack has a laptop sleeve, which is pretty much essential these days. As for the quality of the construction, the bag is solid and well made. You know, it used to be that if you weren't buying a Nrthface or Ptagonia bag, you weren't getting good quality. That paradigm has simply changed. Now you can get an off-brand backpack like this one that is every bit as good as many of the name brand bags. If you're looking for a simple backpack with some minimalist style, this bag is very nice.

reviewText:
I recently ordered my husband a size 38 in this LUCHENGYI Men Canvas Belt. I was pleased when it was delivered. When I opened the box there was yet another box ( see pictures below)
Inside a metal black 6x6  attractive box just the box is worthy of mention this would be a nice gift box or as in my case I'm keeping it for myself knowing I'll find a use for it somewhere.

The belt itself is a attractive one. It is thicker than I had thought it would be about 1/4 inches thick maybe a slight more my eyes are not really best these days. The tongue is solid brown leather and the buckle is a matted brownish - gray color metal matches well. The canvas part of belt or the back portion is a darker brown with lighter brown stitching ( see pictures below ) the stitching that runs along the seams are also a lighter beige color. I inspected all seams for loose threads or flaws and could not find any. The overall craftsmanship of this belt I would say is very good.

  My husband likes it very much and it fits him well. I ordered a 38 and when I went to show my husband the size I could not find it anywhere on the belt. I would suggest they stamp size somewhere on belt. Other than that he loves it and I'm happy his pants are not sagging.

I would recommend this belt it is attractive, well made and priced fairly.

Disclosure.  I received this product in exchange for my honest unbiased review. This discount does not effect or influence my opinion of this product.

It's made of  leather and durable canvas, and is 1.5"inches wide. It's a very manly looking belt and it's not flimsy it's solid and does not roll over it's self like some belts do. It fits through your belt loops perfect. This belt not only looks durable it feels durable too like it will last a very long time. This hat is a bit on the small side as far as fit is concerned. I needed a 7 1/4 size.  One size fits most should work for sizes between 7 - 71/2. According to the size, it should easily fit 7 1/4 but this hat just fits.  Once it is washed, it may not fit at all. If you need a size 7 1/2, this may not be the hat for you so I have given it 4 stars instead of 5. Over all, this hat is perfect for hiking, camping and yard work. It has several vent holes on each side and also has a snap on each side. The sides can be folded up and snapped like a bush hat but you may sunburn the top of your ears if you do so. The adjustable strap is nice and toggle allows you to push the hat back off your head and still stays strapped to you.  The brim is wide enough that it does a pretty good job at keeping the sun off of your face and neck  while still allowing you to easily stow it in a backpack etc. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.
summary: it should easily fit 7 1/4 but this hat just fits

reviewText:
This belt appears to be good quality materials and constuction.  I like the colors.  The black side is a flat black which is good for a casual look.  The brown side is a fairly light brown, maybe a dark tan.
One thing I did notice is that it's about an inch shorter than a Levi brand belt that I've owned and worn for a couple of years.  It still works for me, but I'm wearing it in the first hole.  On my Levi brand belt I was between the 2nd and 3rd hole.  Take that into consideration when selecting a size.
The reversible buckle works good.  It's the same design as a dress belt I've had for years,.  I expect it to work for the life of the belt.
 All in all, I'm a pleased customer.  This is a belt I would select if I were shopping in a local clothing store.  I received this belt at a reduced price for a honest review.
summary: Good quality, good colors on both sides.  Seems to run a little short

Pros:
1. For the entire 10 seconds of its life, it was a really nice belt and I felt a surge in my self esteem while putting it on.
2. The cardboard box that it came in is infinitely more durable than the belt itself. And you can cover it with cool paper mache, so that's kind of a bonus!
3. The bonded leather came pre-separated right out of that awesome box, so you can easily peel it the rest of the way to make two belts and gift one to a friend or co-worker - or make an old-tyme barber style razor-sharpening strop out of it.
Cons:
1. The buckle is attached to the belt using a very small diameter pin. It's metal, but a very cheap alloy. As I was buckling it for the very first time, it snapped in two.
2. The seemingly cheap price is actually quite expensive when amortized over the duration of its usefulness, at around $50/minute, or about $5,000,000/year. I try to limit my purchase decisions to belts that cost less than $1,000,000/year, even if they're reversible. Well, maybe a little more if they come in a cool cardboard box. But, this is 5x my usual budgeted cost for belts. Now, off to try on some suspenders.

reviewText: as advertised!

If whoever manufactures these, release one with a zipper and a velcro patch on it. :/ Maybe having a patch on it to change out, or something would distract people from the jacket until more people start wearing this style around...

Perhaps there are multiple manufacturers producing this shirt and my order happened to get diverted to the rip-off sweat shop?

If you are working somewhere on dry ground with not too much debris or grease, these will be fine, but do take note that particles get stuck inside easily and its a pain to remove all of it. I am going through the process of returning them right now. Not to mention they are also quite uncomfortable, for the back of the shoe hits your achilles. TL;DR they are uncomfortable and ineffective.

reviewText: One of my favorite shirts. Fits and stays through the wash well....

the non-slip sole is incredible and the insoles are surprisingly comfy (they're rubber foam so they don't absorb water). food stains, even gooey sauces, wipe off easily. great quality for the price.

I do have the same issue a lot of buyers mentioned in their reviews, in that I get a lot of food & muck stuck in the treads from working in food service. this doesn't seem to affect the grip at all, and is a price I'm willing to pay. I've found it's actually pretty easy to clean out if you leave the soles soaking in a half-inch of water for 20-60 minutes, and then spray the treads down with a sprayer until the water runs clear (I use my detachable showerhead, but a sink attachment or a garden hose with a nozzle would probably also work). dislodge remaining debris by running a toothpick through the grooves and repeating the previous step. I'm gonna try using a steel wire brush soon, I'll update my review when I find out if it works.
summary: wipe off easily. great quality for the price

reviewText: the fabric is very comfortable..

These are great. Nice fit and very silky soft. Be sure to read the sizing instructions. I received all the colors in the picture except for red. The ones I got instead of red were more of a pinkish color. I also ordered a 3 pack of red and actually got red. The people who gave these a bad review obviously did not read the size guide.  Asian sizes are not the same as US sizes.  If you got a size too small then you may need to LEARN TO READ. It's not because your legs, ass or junk are too large. It's because your brain is too small. Get tested for Zika.

Ok let me first start off by saying that the quality of this product is excellent and I really like the large selection of colors to choose from (red and black are my favorites). I will say that the sizes are of course subjective because as we all know each guy is different which makes choosing the correct size a bit of a challenge.

I have a 31" waste and am athletically built. According to the sizing chart I fit smack dab in-between two sizes which of course worried me because it was now a toss up between which size would be right for me. Because so many peoples reviews said go with the size up if you're from North America of the UK (I'm from the U.S.) I went with the XL size which was 31-34". As it turned out while the waste line was fine since the material is a soft and stretches but the front pocket was simple not going to cut it and I would not describe myself as "large" up front :-), but simply average. I started a return with Amazon, but this particular order was not with Prime so it has to go to the seller who then decides if they will accept my return. This is were my experience hit an all time high!

I can't even begin to express my gratitude for the way this product vendor treated me! As noted earlier the sizes for this product can be very hard for a guy to choose from because we're all different sizes. While I needed to return this product due to the size not being quite right I still really liked the quality overall so I had panned to return the current order and repurchase with the next size up. I was then contacted by Cece (product rep) the very next day (She's in China so there's a time difference) and she took care of everything for me promptly answering all questions. The new order was shipped and she even provided me with a tracking number. I had replacements in I think about two weeks which is very fast considering they're in China and I'm in the U.S. Here's the kicker. Cece would not accept my return and instead told me to keep the original order as a free gift! Ok they're a little small up front, but not so much that they're unusable so yes I will wear them and as such I not only didn't have to deal with the return order process, but got and extra set of briefs for no cost to me! While I can't guarantee everyone would get that same deal (nor should anyone EXPECT it), it was still a very gracious offer and the BEST EXPERIENCE I've ever had on Amazon with any vendor!

Oh and as far as the briefs go the material is very soft and hugs your boy parts with a bit of a pouch at the bottom. I do wish that the pouch extended upward a bit more with a seam that creates more of a pouch as I think that would make them fit more men in general if they did that. The back is perfect coverage for me and I think would be for 99% of all guys. Colors in the pics were all accurate except for maybe the brighter green color (I bought another pack of these with that color included) which was definitely more neon green than the image would indicate. The yellow is a bit on the sheer size so while I didn't get white I wold assume that the white is as well. Still I like the brightness of the yellow, but the red and black are my favorites. The packaging is also great with each pair in it's own Ziploc package with a tag that is attached by a small pin (high class if you ask me). And last but not least the sides while narrow are very soft and stretchy and do not feel like they are cutting into my sides at all including the ones I have that are a size too small.

Overall great product and outstanding customer support!
summary: If I Could Give the Product vendor 10 Stars I Would. Product is Top Notch Too. Buy One Size Up Guys!

Of course, I must now find a warm winter coat still....or wear the old one.

Life.

Thank you Amazon.

It was still tight in the shoulders and I'm not exactly a linebacker. If you wear any larger than a small or an xs I do not recommend  purchasing this jacket. It is decorative and that's about it, I liken it to a fancy hoodie. I have hooded sweatshirts that are warmer than this. So, it will not keep you warm. If you live where temps can hit below zero, this coat may work for about 1-2  months out of the year. Where I live, there's almost always a sudden drop in temperature, so a fall coat usually isn't very functional. Maybe for late summer evening walks? I wish it was not so thin and flimsy. In a warmer climate, sure it's cute and it may be what you're looking for but beware if it's actually chilly outside. I'm thinking about returning it, I cannot say it isn't stylish but function over fashion wins when it comes to me.
summary: If you wear any larger than a small or an xs I do not recommend purchasing this jacket

This is by far the worst cosplay prop I've ever owned or used. Not only is it excruciatingly uncomfortable to wear, but the straps are also pretty much guaranteed to break on you within five minutes of wearing it. This thing is made of a thick but pliable plastic with some foam padding on the back part that goes against your face, and then has two adjust straps on each side which snap lock in the back to secure the mast to your face. The main problem with this mask is that the sides are not angled back to fit around a face. The mask is flat and the sides only angle back to fit along your jaw and cheeks when they're pulled with great force by the straps. So in order to make this thing look like a mask when put on, the straps have to be tight enough to bend back the sides... and this means the mask is being pulled straight into the very front of your face HARD, with all that pressure going specifically right onto the tip of your nose. It was uncomfortable from the moment I put it on and became unbearably painful in under a minute. Then, before I even had the chance to start taking it off, one of the straps broke. The straps are connected to the mask with one little metal rivet each, and the pressure needed to keep the sides bent was just too much for the little rivet and it broke away from the plastic. I looked to see if I could just use pliers or something to put it back on, but that didn't work. To fix it for real I'd need to use something like a small nut and bolt and run it all the way through the plastic. I did not have any so I just used hot glue figuring I could just hang the mask up or something. For the second, identical replacement mask I received, the exact same thing happened. After the experience with the first one I had no intention of actually wearing it, but I wanted to at least get a picture of it on my face. I made the straps as long as I could to put the least amount of pressure on my face, but even that wasn't enough. Within moments of putting it on, before I could even get my camera up to take a picture, a strap on that one broke as well. So yeah, I would not recommend that anyone buy this particular mask, especially for $30 which is a simply outrageous price for how uncomfortable and cheaply made this is. If you found my review helpful please let me know by hitting that YES button below otherwise please leave me a comment letting me know what I can do to improve. Thanks a bunch!
summary: Worst mask ever! Cheaply made and too uncomfortable wear

If I'd gotten the small instead (something I debated with myself a lot) it would have been too loose on me and not form fitting or very flattering like it's supposed to be. It is made of very stretchy material as other reviewers have said and will stretch with your body. So if you are similar to my size but a bit bigger in one of those areas or a couple you should still be able to get the same size as I did and it fit well on you. I'd definitely read over other reviews though as well to get a good idea before you order. Very pleased and am excited to wear this to my mom's wedding this coming Saturday!!

reviewText:
I ended up purchasing a last minute flight on spirit airlines.  I knew I didn't want to spend money on expensive baggage fees.  So, I went to amazon to find the largest bag I could take on spirit for the least amount of money.  After searching, I settled upon this one based on its size to price ratio.

Pros:
Can take on Spirit or Frontier for free
Has zipper compartments
zippers held up
Will fit a macbook pro straight up against the back

Now, the Cons:
Horrible off-gassing vapor smell (I ran this through the dryer to try and disipate the smell. which mostly worked)
Shoulder strap anchor points both bent and then broke
Style is straight early 90's middle age traveler

If you need a bag in a pinch to get on spirit, this might be your bag.  Just don't expect to use the shoulder strap

reviewText:
We are very big Saddleback Leather fans.  This purse is our latest purchase.  Saddleback products are for people who appreciate the quality that every leather product ought to have.  We have otherwise become disgusted with how the leather product industry has cheapened along with other things in our culture.  To me, "old school" is not wrong or bad; past generations seem to have cared a lot more about how their customers feel about their products, and how long their product lasted.  Saddleback is right: Their products improve with use; the more "patina," if any, the more valuable they become.  They are both rugged, and easy to care for.

This purse is a little bigger than I thought when I bought it, but my wife loves it.

I think Saddleback could prosper even more if they gave some additional attention to what more women need in a purse.  Like, right-sizing, for what women usually need.  Examples:

1. I think there needs to be a line of Saddleback purses sized in-between, that carries mainly just a big wallet and a big iPhone, a coin purse, and those other little things women carry. Saddleback's clutch purse is too small for the big iPhone and the women's big wallet, etc., while this satchel purse is too big, in my opinion.  My wife's opinion is that it is not too big; she absolutely loves it.  She can even fit her Saddleback-covered iPad in this purse with everything else, although then the purse becomes too heavy, so she won't usually be carrying her iPad around in it.

2. Maybe Saddleback can take another look at the glorious latch mechanism, and come up with one more option that might be easier to open quickly with one hand.

I hope Saddleback never goes away, and never falls into the cheapening process like so many other companies have (probably because most other companies are run by boards of greedy investors).
summary: If Everyone Knew about Their Products, Saddleback Could Become Bigger Than Microsoft

reviewText: Nice Bag. When you buy from Saddleback, you will get a piece that will last your lifetime. It's heavy and built to outlast you. If you are looking for a light purse to throw around during a night out on the town, this is not the purse for you. This is meant for everyday use and abuse. The purse is a classic style and color. It looks very expensive and well made. You will get a ton of compliments. It's exactly as pictured so I won't bother including photos of my own. The one negative thing I could say about it, I'm not a fan of the clasp. It took time getting used to. It should be bigger and easier to use. But that's me be overly critical.

Rich, lustrous, functional and ruggedly tough, this purse has at all! This is probably my 12th or 13th piece from Saddleback and, by far, it is my absolute favorite.

The purse is very comfortable to carry, even loaded down with my iPad, wallet, padfolio and lunch, and it is simultaneously absolutely gorgeous! I have no doubt my mind that you could fill this with bricks, carry around quite comfortably, and have it looking better with the wear! It's that good.

I purchased the chestnut purse and the contrast between the two color leathers is even better than I imagined. The bag itself is a deep, dark red, with subtle creases in the leather emphasizing the life and depth of the animal. The dimension is just incredible while the nude suela leather is creamy, pure and untouched. It showcases the chestnut leather beautifully. I can't stress enough how gorgeous this purse is. I love it.

On another note, this may be just me as all of my Saddleback pieces are well broken in, but the leather did seem a little bit more dry upon arrival than I remembered. This was not a problem for me as I was already planning on conditioning it again when I received the purse.

The raw suela leather apparently soaks oils rather quickly and I desired a more uniform aging of my purse handles, which is why I treated the leather. The handles turned a very light golden amber color afterwards and ended up looking even better than when it came out of the bag! I had my doubts about darkening the handles but they were all erased immediately when I stepped away and viewed the results!

The only thing I'm not a huge fan of is the tobacco leather lining. Saddleback recently changed their pigskin to offer a softer quality product with the same level of protection. While I love the fact that they did this, this tobacco leather was definitely more aged than I anticipated. The pigskin lining is extremely soft, but is more of a mottled, dirty tobacco color. Treating it did nothing to effect the color in any way. I'm not a fan of it at all as it creates such a vast contrast from the high-end luxury of the exterior, but at least the inside my purse will never look any dirtier, that's for sure!

Overall, I would buy this purse all over again. I would gift it to my mother, my sisters, my best friend, my colleagues. It's a workhorse large enough to hold everything you need in the day yet it's beauty is unsurpassed. I adore this purse and I'm looking forward to many, many years of using it. Thanks yet again Saddleback!
summary: A Rich, Luxurious Workhorse of a Purse

reviewText:
I'd been searching for a purse for a long time and had some very specific requirements.

It had to stand on its own, and would preferably have feet.
It wouldn't become floppy and start falling over after a period of time.
It had to have an open compartment on the inside.
It also needed to be able large enough to hold my B5 notebook.

Somewhere, I came across Saddleback leather. While I was initially cautious because of the price tag, viewing the videos and seeing other testimonials changed my mind. I figured I could continue paying $40-50 a pop for purses that almost met my requirements, or I could get something that would last until the end of my days.

This purse is better than I imagined. As you can see from the photos, this thing will hold a lot of stuff. That grey and orange notebook measures 7x9 inches and there's still over an inch of room to spare. It is easy for small things to get lost at the bottom, so I'd recommend using a small pouch for those little things.

This purse is solid. There is no way that this purse will start sagging and flopping over in any direction. The top grain leather outside, with the pigskin inside, along with some reinforcing along the front flap will ensure that this beauty stands tall, no matter what.

And it is beautiful. I chose black, which is stunning with the suela. It's classic and rugged at the same time. Saddleback advertises that the suela darkens over time, and it'll turn to a delicious honey color. I chose to help this along a little when I conditioned the purse.

Many people are concerned about the latch mechanism. I don't know if it's a change for all of their new purses, but mine does not swivel like the other pictures. The latch is still stiff, but I have no issues opening the purse one-handed. It does take me a little more maneuvering to close it, but it doesn't spin around.

Bottom line, this purse is worth every penny. My days of "almost right" bags are over.

I got a Saddleback satchel 4 years ago to use as a purse. While I loved how sturdy and well-made it was, I always wished it looked a bit more like a ladies' purse. It had a very men's messenger bag look and my husband immediately wanted it for himself. (I'm giving that old bag to him now, all worn in - lucky him!) But when I started looking for a new bag, I immediately went to Saddleback again. I'm kind of like a convert to their leather, because it's just SUCH high quality. I was thrilled to see this new design. After months and months of saving up and waiting, I finally got it. Some thoughts: BEST THINGS: * Seriously rugged. In other words, it's a Saddleback. If you don't know what that means, then you're in for a treat - go check out the videos on the website and you'll see. This stuff is made with the highest quality full grain leather and it's tough as nails and gorgeous to boot. My previous Saddleback bag only got prettier the more I roughed it up and dragged it around. (Compare that with a high-end designer bag I was given that began to fall apart within a month - and they were both in the $300 range!) It seems the more you use these things, the prettier they get. * Great design. I loved the original satchel, too. This one is great also though, perhaps with a slight (very slight) advantage of looks to function ratio. That's okay, I wanted the looks. The main compartment is pretty big (my mom looked in it and said, 'whoa! that's like a toolbox in there') - but it's surprisingly lighter than I thought (it's lighter than the messenger satchel I have from Saddleback, which surprised me). The key fob and inner and outer pockets are useful. There's a minimum of interior organization, which means I have to keep it neat, but I can fit more stuff in (including my DSLR camera in it's case, amazingly enough). Also, it opens so wide and has a light-colored interior so it's easy to see into. The cross-body strap and handles make for easy carrying whatever your preference. * Feels good to carry. This is kind of a big one for me. The saddleback satchel was kind of on the heavy side. Maybe I'm used to that beast, but this feels lighter by comparison. It's still pretty heavy-duty and so correspondingly heavyish, but it's not bad. Also the strap is a bit slimmer, but still strong (has that polyester lining in it) so it's much more comfortable cross-body. Also, the attachments for the cross-body strap are a much nicer hardware set up than my old satchel (that one screwed shut and sometimes came undone. these have a hinge and snap shut - much more secure and easier). The suela handles are really comfy, too. * Looks amazing. I got the black. I love a good, classic black purse, but a lot of the saddleback bags were such that I didn't like the design when it was in the black color. The suela + black just pops. It's SO pretty and classic. After I got this, I walked through a department store display of designer bags and realized my saddleback was way prettier to me and more classic than all of those. I just love it. I've only had it a week and already got several compliments of people wanting to know what it was and where I got it. It's very striking, but very classy. It strikes a really awesome balance between rugged and lady-like, classic and unexpected. I love that. GOOD STUFF: (Not pros and cons, just what I love vs. what I like): * The clasp. - Okay, I read a LOT on that clasp before buying this and was really leery of it. Here's the thing: it's not the simplest thing to open. However, I really like it all the same. What else would you use, I kind of want to know? I mean, the clasp really looks nice. It adds so much to the look of the bag. And it keeps the thing shut and keeps anyone from getting into the bag. The thing that I couldn't see in pictures is that the clasp is on a sort of pin that allows it to rotate 360. Now, saddleback hardware is nigh indestructible (stainless steel horse tackle is basically what they use), so I know it will last. The thing is that because the clasp rotates a bit, it's rarely laying quite the way you left it. Sometimes I can reach over and flip the thing open one-handed - and even close it one handed. Other times, it's twisted around to another angle and I need to concentrate and use both hands to get it open or shut. To me, that's a pretty minor thing for an overall amazing bag. If you're used to magnetic snaps, it may annoy you at first. But it will last much, much longer. And it looks so pretty. This is my for-looks bag. And also, the other satchels have a strap-and-belt-buckle getup which is also a bit of work to open and close. That's just the price I figure I have to pay for people not getting into my bag easily - I have to take a moment to get into my bag, too. * Base & feet. I do wonder why the base-plate of suela is not glued or sewn down. I keep wondering if junk will collect in there. I mean, that's a pretty minor thing for an overall amazing bag, but I do wonder about that. For a future design, I wonder if they'll revisit it. * Black thread on the suela. I didn't realize this until I got the bag, but the thread is the same color throughout. So that means the thread holding the suela down on the bag is black like the rest of the body (and that's continuous poly thread - that stuff does NOT fray, I can tell you that from my previous satchel which I dragged all over the place.) It makes an...interesting look. It's not bad, exactly. It just ... I dunno. It's not peach on black - it's black lines around the peach on black. It's a subtly more western nod than I was expecting. Again, not bad, but look closely at the photos and you can see it. If that's going to totally annoy you, maybe go for the tobacco bag which has a closer-to-suela colored thread? Again, a really, really small thing, but something I did notice. Summary: Overall, this bag is a workhorse - a lovely, aristocratic workhorse - and I'm super excited to have this become my forever signature bag. I imagine I may get other products from Saddleback eventually (belt? wallet?) but one thing I won't need to do is get another bag. This bag is just perfect.
summary: Saddleback Leather is the best stuff ever and this purse is so gorgeous I can't even

This pendant is beautiful, sturdy, well crafted and just right. It took me many years to find the right piece of jewelry to carry a bit of my dog with me.  I constantly get complements on it.  It's a nice piece to wear every day.  It doesn't look like a memorial piece so you don't have to let anyone know you're carrying your loved one with you unless you want to.
I swapped out the chain with a sturdier one, since the one that came with it is very thin and I didn't trust it not to break.
The one big drawback is actually putting the ashes into the pendant.  The funnel that comes with it is paper and crumpled, I ended up using a metal funnel from a flask. The opening is very small.  It was upsetting that I had to get ashes everywhere.  My advice is to lay down newspaper to catch any ashes that may fall while you're filling it. If you're squeamish about handling cremated remains, have a friend or family member fill this for you, as you will  have to touch ashes.
Another tip is to use crazy glue on the threads of the stopper when you screw it shut.  This will prevent and accidental spillage or losing the pendant.

summary: A beautiful piece to keep loved ones ashes close to you..

reviewText: The set fits in very well small slotted screws. They make the job very easy.

Also had to demagnetize them.

If you can't do these things this tools will be worthless.
Works fine

The color coding is helpful. Tip sizes seem to be correct, but as other purchasers stated; I did not receive replacement tips either! All eight of my driver's top -swivels just fine. DO NOTE that the set screw for the removable tip is on one side only. I tell you this because once I noticed there were no extra tips I removed one tip thinking possibly it was machined on the other side as well (ITS  NOT!). So when I went to tighten the set screw I noticed it was missing! I thought for sure it had stuck to the tip of the other screwdriver and therefore lost it. After searching the counter and the floor for 10 minutes, I realized that the screw was still in the driver... just on the opposite side. Meaning: the machine thread goes completely through, and the set screw is only on one side. So don't freak out like I did, LOL.
summary: No replacement tips as was offered!

reviewText: As others have mentioned, the listing makes you believe that you get a spare set of tips with this....you do not, or at least I didn't. Otherwise, they seem ok. reviewText: Super cute, lightweight wearable blanket. I bought this and similar wearable blankets for my grandson because he always kicks off his blankets. This way he stays warm and looks cute at the same time.

I wish this had worked out.

I was looking for a baggy one piece pajama for my toddler. He has a tendency to kick off pajama bottoms but can't sleep without them. Footie pajamas are either too tight or too long. This style was the solution. Loose enough for easy diaper changes (though it would be nice if the zipper was a little longer for easy diaper changes) .I love the polar bear design. The cotton is warm but breathable.

I would have given it four stars.

Unfortunately, the zipper broke after a week. Several of the zipper teeth at the bottom snapped right off. I wasn't undoing the zipper with my teeth or picking my son up by the zipper. I was zipping up his pajamas in the traditional way.

  I'll be returning them and looking elsewhere for a sturdier pajama.

That being said, after I washed it once it shrank quite a bit and, although it's still big, it shrank enough that it can be used now (it's a wearable blanket, so it doesn't need to fit tightly).  I love this because it keeps my daughter from being able to kick her way out of her pajamas (she usually kicks around and gets her feet stuck in one leg hole during the night) and keeps her nice and warm without being a suffocation hazard.

reviewText:
As an owner of other Latex products, I've come to find you definitely get what you pay for. This is an actual latex piece of clothing, not rubber as some other reviewer has described, the material is definitely on the thin side compared to other latex items I've purchased (not from Amazon, direct Latex clothing manufacturers).

It does not come pre polished so if you want the shiny look as advertised you need to purchase latex polish / oil and treat it. There seems to be an excess amount of material in the crotch area that made for some flaps I had to fold under to look correct. After polishing the material and wearing it I wish there was just one size up I could have gotten as the straps started to wear on my shoulders and I believe from it being just slightly too small for my build.

Things that would get me to buy another product:
- Offering one more size larger than currently available.
- trim down on the material used in the front crotch area.
- Advertise that polish/oil is needed to achieve the shiny look as pictured.
summary: Generic latex one piece of clothing.

This is a very heavy duty leather punch. I had a different one before and my husband bent it after just a couple of uses. This one has punched thru a very thick leather belt and a gun holster with no problems at all. I expect it to hold up much better than the last one I had. I can tell a difference just in the weight. This new one weighs twice as much as my last one. I am very satisfied with this purchase and would purchase again if needed although I don't think I'll need to. This product was received at a discount on exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This saved my favorite belt!  I had a belt made in Tennessee a few years ago.  It's a hand made leather belt that is brown with purple etched butterflies on it.  I absolutely love it, but when I had it made I didn't have it sized properly or I lost weight.  Either way the belt didn't fit anymore, so it just sat on a shelf for a couple of years. Then I saw this.

I attached a picture of the instructions. Nothing is in English, but the pictures are self explanatory.
This belt puncher is very easy to understand.  You just pick the right sized "tooth", insert your belt and clamp down.  Only problem is that it does take a good deal of force to clamp down on the belt.  I was able to do it by myself though without problem.  I just worked the belt around the spike and kind of wiggled it a bit.  After not too long I had a perfect hole.  It was nice and clean with no jagged edges.

I fully recommend this belt puncher for anyone who wants to make that perfect belt last a little longer.

I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for a fair review.

For less than $15 these aren't bad.  They are comfy and feel like they will hold together well.  There is a small pocket built into the front of the waistband which is a small bonus. The waistband isn't overly tight like some running/yoga pants.  No unflattering muffin top while just standing around and they do a more than decent job while sitting. :)

The pink/peach color looks just like in the photo, but when the pants are on the stretched fabric makes the color look less vibrant. I guess it's just how the fabric is dyed because I am not even close to overstretching these pants.  Also, while on the fabric looks like there is a splotchy grey stain... I only noticed it because I was looking for defects like that and I can only see it when the pants are on me. I thought maybe I got a bad one so I reordered (still have the first pair here) and the "stains" on the second pair are worse!  They are not very dark but look like I have a bad bruise that is visible under the light peach fabric. Maybe it will wash out? And despite being very dark grey they are still slightly see through. I'm not sure anyone else would notice my panty outlines but again that was what I was looking for so it was noticeable to me.

These kinda make me feel like a sea-world employee, not really a positive or negative, just kind get that vibe while wearing them.
Overall good pants for the price with a nice design and fun colors.

reviewText: Dress is not an authentic Calvin Klein dress. I purchased the same dress last year from Nordstrom. It was damaged and I love it so much I wanted to find a replacement. The pattern on the dress I received is different from the original dress I purchased. The buckle and the hardware on the buckle also does not match. I also received the dress with the shoddy stitching around the buckle unraveling. I returned immediately ad informed Amazon to let everyone interested in this dress to know that it is NOT an authentic Calvin Klein dress. It is a replica with the full price designer price tag. I believe the real Calvin Klein tags were sewn in to a fake dress. Also the tags on the sleeve are funny. There is stickers over the UPC numbers on the tag I am thinking so Amazon does not scan that tag and notice the UPC is from another dress. BUYER BEWARE!!!!

First of all, it's pretty clear that this isn't really Calvin Klein. It's just another Chinese manufacturer using their label. Clue one was the faux wrap neckline which is really awkwardly stitched together just above the cleavage. This makes the neckline sit above the hairline in the back which means a bad hairday is almost guaranteed. Clue two is the crappy pleather buckle straps and the buckle itself which won't stay flush so your left arm constantly snags on it making the situation worse and I'd imagine eventually also causing a hole in the arm. My third issue is with the length because it comes down below my knees which is really awkward for a sweater dress. This may or may not be a sizing issue. After reading reviews, I sized up but I really wish I hadn't because it is WAY too big so it's possible they made the larger size much longer as well. Some manufacturers have a tendency to do that since they think anyone in need of larger sizes must be an amazon. At any rate, I'll probably be returning this since it isn't at all what I was looking for.
summary: Calvin Klein? More like Kalvin Clein!

reviewText: I was very please with how each monkey looked.  They looked so realistic and adorable.  You can see each tiny little hair on the monkeys.  I bought this for a birthday present and cannot wait to see the look on the child's face.  She is obsessed with monkeys and I think she will love this.

I love these three little monkeys.  I only wish I could keep my mouth closed, refuse to see all the bad stuff going on in the world, and be completely disinterested in "water cooler" gossip at work.  I'm not so great at any of these things but this charm helps me to remember to at least try.  This is the first time I have purchased a charm that didn't come from the more expensive company.  I would bet you know what company I'm referring to.  I got tired of paying ridiculous prices but I am a charm junkie.  So, I bought this charm for a fraction of what I was accustomed to paying.  I was very shocked when I received it.  It is every bit as nice as my other charms.  I've gotten tons of compliments on it (usually at the "water cooler" where I probably shouldn't be. ha).  I did receive the charm for a reduced price in order to review it.  I will be glad to pay retail prices for my next purchases.  Save your money.  Who doesn't want to be pleased with their purchase and richer for it.
summary: Speak no evil, see no evil, hear no evil.

reviewText:

I am excited and will watch this seller for many other charms as I have many friends and relatives that are always looking for charms.
All in all, I really like the charm and it looks exactly as I expected it to look from the description and photos.

reviewText:
This is an adorable charm for a necklace. It has some bulk to it, so it is not light weight, but it is still comfortable. Even though the photo shows a chain, it doesn't come with one. But the description makes that clear to the buyer so it's not a bait and switch type thing at all. I haven't worn it for long periods of time, but the quality seems to be good. No skin discoloration yet, which is typically my biggest problem with costume type jewelry such as this.

All in all, I really like the charm and it looks exactly as I expected it to look from the description and photos.

I received this item at a discounted price in exchange for an honest review.

The material is substantial and keeps in place very well-is stretchy but not  too much so.  It was 100 degrees here in the south and I wore the white one with an underscarf and still was not so hot.  Once I place it on my head,  it stays very nicely and covers extremely well.  I would say this is almost perfect one piece.  Also, the underscarf  works well for me -- actually I prefer the additional underpiece.  Also,  these wash up very nicely.  Just throw them in the washer (I wash in cold water)  and dry on low (or you hang them up to air dry) Please do not stop selling these as, Insha'Allah,  I will come back for more as mine wear out and also as  gifts.  Shukran,  Kareema

I received my purse today.  I selected this one mainly because of the size.  I love hobo bags but hate carrying giant purses.  My current purse was too small for my wallet, cell phone, sunglasses, and my son's epipen.  This one is PERFECT!  The size is big enough for everything I need to carry daily and has extra room for my coupon wallet on grocery day and my iPad when we go on vacation.  And yet it's not so big that I feel like I'm dragging around a beach bag or a piece of luggage.  There are a couple drawbacks that buyers should be aware of.  I bought this bag in the mustard yellow.  It is definitely mustard yellow, not quite as vibrant as the picture.  And there are a couple of very small spots on the suede.  I've opted to keep the bag instead of exchanging it for one that is pristine because it's yellow so it's going to get stains on it and now I won't feel bad about getting the first stain on it.  The other complaint I would have to point out is that the lining is really cheap.  I mean REALLY.  It's a stiff vinyl that sounds like paper crinkling when it moves.  Again, not a deal breaker for me.  But if you expect a nicely lined bag with cute fabric, this is not going to make you happy.  (I'm adding to the original review after carrying the bag for a few weeks)  I still like the size but the lining already has a tear in it.  And the black dye from the lining is discoloring my wallet.  At this point, I would not recommend this product.

reviewText:
This is one hell of glasses for $30.00
The frame is made out of Titanium and it IS also polarized sunglasses.  I already owned a couple of similar, very thin, very light titanium sunglasses from other company, Eyekeeper titanium polarized sunglasses at $35.95 and I have been using that sunglasses for a year and a half without any problems.  However, the Eyekeeper is Not-foldable sunglasses and since it wasn't foldable, it was bit difficult to store it in my bag.

Anyway, initially, i bought Maui Jim Sandhill Polarized at $275.00 because I just loved the look, titanium, foldable and square lenses.  however, I had to return because it was bit too small for my face.

When I saw this Fonex titanium sunglasses, it had everything that I wanted.  Titanium, very thin and light, square lenses, polarized and EXTREMELY GREAT PRICING.  So, I took a chance and bought one.
I got it today and I am very happy with the product.  Of course, it is not Maui Jim, but it is not $275.00 either.  Titanium frame seems to be strong enough to last few years, lenses are bit thin, but it is well polarized.  Specially, I think that the frame is well screwed into the lenses that I do not think that it will get loose or be broken soon.  Probably it will soon or later and probably it is not as strong as the titanium Maui Jim Sandhill, but for the price, it is really excellent product.

As far as the quality of polarized lenses are concerned, again, it is not as clear as my other name brand sunglasses, such as Maui Jim, Persol & Ray Ban, but let's say that Maui Jim lenses quality is 9.5 out of 10, and Persol & Ray Ban are about 8.9.  This Fonex is about 8 out of 10.  Still pretty good for its kind.
summary: it is a foldable, titanium, very thin/light polarized sunglasses.  Great for Asian face (wide) and well constructed.

So let me just start out with I never buy clothes on Amazon since its very intimidating to try and find a seller that's not a crappy company in the back of someone's basement.
This jacket does not have that problem. If you're worried about shipment? Don't be. Im currently deployed in the military and I was trying to find something in time to wear on my flight home, and I bought this jacket, shipment said it wouldn't be here for 8-12 weeks, and it came here in 2. If you're worried about size? The measurements are spot on. The color is the same color, the jacket is the same jacket. Overall, I am very impressed, and quite surprised, at how well its made. I would definitely invest in this coat, it is beautiful, the material is decently good, and the look is wonderful, especially when you remove the bottom half. Definitely 5/5!

I love this coat but two things need to be pointed out about it.
1. Unless you're teeny tiny, shoulders will almost certainly be a little tight, and unless you have no chest (I ordered largest size available, have 38D bust) at all the odds are good that you won't be able to zip it up because I can't get anywhere close to doing so despite not being overweight at all.  This wasn't a concern for me though, as I want the coat open at all times anyway, and the shoulders aren't tight enough that it is a mobility issue, but other buyers might not like this.

2. The coat is very, very long, and the length of the coat goes up significantly with the largest sizes, which results in the coat trailing along the ground (I'm 5'7'').  Unless you are very tall you are probably going to want to get it hemmed; I plan on doing that myself.

So this coat is either for people who are very tall and thin or people who don't mind slightly snug tops they can't zip up and who are willing to get the coat hemmed.

Beyond all this, I think the coat is very unusual and absolutely lovely, and being able to have just the top gives the piece versatility that my wardrobe is in desperate need of. I picked grey because the black read a little too... catholic priest to me, and grey goes with pretty much anything.  It gives me a military vibe that tickles my fancy.  I adore it and I can't wait to get it hemmed so I can wear the full piece.  For me, it is a 5 star product, but it definitely isn't for everyone.

Also, the tag it came with has some of the most adorable Engrish I've ever seen and I'm going to turn it into a fridge magnet.  <3
summary: Bit of an odd fit but I don't care.  I love it.

reviewText: Nice corduroy. Bright red color and true to size. I bought several colors.

the jury's still out on this Christmas gift for my wife - it's a beautiful shirt, well made, great color (fig), fits nicely - she's 5-9, slim enough to wear small sometimes, other times medium - she has long arms and long legs and has problems finding clothes with long enough sleeves and legs, so I ordered a medium in this shirt - and the sleeves are borderline - I think one washing would make shorten the sleeves enough to ruin it - may have to return for a large, which could be too big in the shoulders

but really - makers of women's shirts especially should get a clue - would it ruin your bottom line to add some length to arms just to be sure every woman can wear your shirts, not just those with shorter arms?

UPDATE 1/16/18: yeah, have to return it - my wife doesn't return things lightly, she gives them time - but when she bends her arm and the sleeve comes halfway up her forearm, well, that doesn't work - and again, corduroy shrinks, so the sleeve length would be even worse. Better too long than too short. So I'm lowering the stars to two instead of three - not one star because the shirt is very nice in all other ways - color and quality seem very good. reviewText: A little stiff, but I expect that to relax and the quality is great.
Size 32 waist and medium was perfect for me.

This belt rocks.  It doesn't slip!!!  You have to get used to adjusting it but how hard is it to feed slack through from one side of the buckle and pull it through the other?  Piece of cake.  What sets this belt apart is that the material is relatively thick and somewhat rigid.  I find that important so that it doesn't allow the belt loop in the back of the shorts/pants/whatever from curling the belt or, alternatively, the waste of the belt from curling over.  The quality is impressive and you will really love the black cover and quality rivets on the end.  These belts travel well and I actually bought five of them in different colors.  Measure yourself carefully.  I have a 36 waste and use the medium.  It gives about four inches of extra, enough to fit under the first loop for most pants.  The large will be just too large, adding another 4-5 inches if memory serves.  Frankly, some seem to like that but I think it is goofy having nine inches of slack wrapped around your body almost to your backside through three loops.  Ideally, I would have liked another inch or two of slack but the medium works just fine and looks good.  The buckle and the anodized surface are fabulous...and by the way, the little dinosaur skeleton thing is actually etched into the metal...like one of those vibrating pen types of things.  You can feel it.  I've received numerous compliments.  Wish I could find in tan.  That would complete my collection.  I have the one in cast iron (color) but often I would like a very light brown/tan to go with shoes.  Hope Arcteryx is reading.
summary: Screams quality, relatively rigid (a good thing), and gets lots of compliments...more than your average casual belt

reviewText: Love this hoodie, I have not washed it yet, but feels soft and comfy, and looks beautiful.  Just slightly bigger than I thought, but perfect for a cool comfy day kinda feel.

I'll start by saying I did a tonne of research on alexandrite before purchasing this ring. A prior buyer wrote a fantastic review far more detailed than I, and included great pictures as one of my biggest concerns with purchasing an alexandrite ring online was that I wasn't going to get to see if it did possess colour changing properties. While lab created, this stone really does change colours in daylight and by candlelight, in soft light and under pot lights. It is a beautiful deep eggplant purple in regular light, changes to a raspberry in different light and has blue/green undertones in different light. The setting is unique with the emerald cut alexandrite turned on its side to be a diamond shape, and the double prongs at each corner are stunning but still lend to simplicity which lets the colour and size of this stone shine through. At 2.75 carats it's not overwhelming in size but is small enough to look "genuine" and not just a cocktail ring. The white gold ring itself is fairly dainty, it looks bigger in the Peora pictures but I was pleased with this feature. Came beautifully packaged in a blue box with a small spotlight when u open the box. A beautiful piece with a unique setting, an affordable alexandrite that does change colours set in white gold. I'm in love.

This Lab Created Alexandrite ring is very attractive and well priced. The gem is nicely faceted, well polished and exhibits 100% color change. A natural Alexandrite of this size, clarity and color change would be $20,000+

The ring arrived in a bubble pack envelope via USPS and had to be sign for. Inside the envelope was a heavier that expected blue box tied with blue ribbon. Inside that box was a blue ring box, that when opened, shines an LED light on the ring, which sits upright in spongy white fabric. As this ring is a gift, the packaging makes for a very nice presentation. (The only improvement in this area I can think of, is a sound chip producing Ooohs & Aaahs and then a burst of applause)

The ring shank appears thinner in real life than in the product photo but I don't believe there is any deception going on. The manufacture of the shank and mount is clean and smooth. The prongs and surrounding cage appear more than adequate to hold the gemstone securely. The Rhodium coating looks well executed, however time will tell its actual quality.

A downside of the ring is that it only comes in size 7. It can be resized by a local jeweler, but that will be a non-trivial additional expense. You should get some estimates about resizing a white gold ring if needed.

Buying synthetic Alexandrite without seeing it in person is a bit of a gamble. Many vendors misuse terms like "Lab" or "Created" as well as "Synthetic" when they should be using the term Simulated Alexandrite. If the Alexandrite is not color changing Chrysoberyl then it should be labeled "Simulated". A common Simulated Alexandrite is heat treated synthetic Corundum laced with Vanadium. It is very pretty in its own right but it does not possess the green color of Alexandrite in daylight. Happily this ring has the real synthetic.

Alexandrite is a little darker than many gemstones but it has nice sparkle and is very durable (8.5 Mohs). These are the colors you can expect to see.
Sunlight:: Green/Teal separated by dark lanes with a sprinkling of pinkish/red flashes.
Open shade: Bright teal with intermittent dark lanes.
Florescent light:: Teal highlights with Amethyst like dark purple lanes.
Incandescent light:: Diffuse pinkish/purple with lighter highlights.
Long wave UV light:: Glows red.

Conclusion: Good value synthetic (Lab Created) Alexandrite ring, almost sure to amaze and delight the recipient.

I am going to try to attach some pictures to show what you get and under various lighting to show the ring's color change effect. These were taken with a phone camera and I don't have proper setup for jewelry photography, so if anything looks ugly it is not the ring's fault.

1) Boxes
2) Open ring box
3) Open shade daylight
4) Incandescent
5,6) Mixed lighting
summary: The gem is nicely faceted, well polished and exhibits 100% color change

I'm a big fan of colorful, fun socks, and these definitely fit the bill.  I'm always on the lookout for new ones, so when I got the chance to purchase these ones at a discount in exchange for an honest review, I jumped at it.  I chose the Yellow & Blue three pack (not to be confused with the Blue & Yellow) mostly because I really liked the look of the yellow polka dots on the blue sock.

The socks only come in one size, 10-13 (this is clearly listed in the description), so they're a bit large on me, but I knew that going in as a size 9.  They feel about right for a 10-13 sock though, size-wise.  The colors are extremely vibrant and the lines appear to be nice and sharp.  They also feel like a good quality sock, but only time will really tell how well they hold up or if they start to develop holes in the toes, fraying around the lines, etc.

Great socks! Definitely fit very well. The material is a bit thin, so I am concerned about how they will hold up over time, but I am optimistic! Either way, they'll be fun while they last! Thanks!

reviewText: I bought these socks for my husband hoping they might make him smile because he has a bad habit of taking life a little too seriously! He did smile, and he actually has reached for these socks first the last several times that I have washed them! :) The colors are bright and vibrant and the patterns are fun without being inappropriate if you coworkers catch a glimpse of them at most business-casual offices. These socks are very soft and they are a nice thickness - thin enough that my husband can comfortably wear them inside of his dress shoes, but thick enough that they will keep his feet warm and they should hold up pretty well. My husband wears a size 10 shoe and these fit perfectly but they also have some stretch to them so they should fit someone with a slightly smaller or even larger shoe size as well. The band around the top is tight enough to hold them up but stretchy enough that they are comfortable to wear. I am very happy with this brand and would absolutely purchase more socks from them in the future! I purchased my first set at a limited promotional rate for testing and evaluation purposes in exchange for my honest review; all thoughts, opinions and experiences are my own.

reviewText: The buttons of the jacket are of low quality.

This jacket is really nice.  I got this for my husband and he really likes it.  I ordered the small (the tag will read XL though), in the light denim wash.  For reference my husband is 5'3" tall, has a chest measurement of 35", and a waist measurement of 33".  This jacket fit him pretty well in the small.  It is a little big but he likes to wear things a little oversized.  I am including a photo of him wearing the jacket so you can see the fit of it.  I took a couple of measurements of the jacket.  From the top of the sleeve to the cuff is 21" in length with the cuff adding another 2.25" to the length.  The breadth of the jacket measures 21".  The only complaint he has about this jacket is there are no pockets for his hands.  I tend to agree with him on that one.  I like pockets on a jacket as well.  Overall he likes this jacket and based on his opinion I recommend this jacket if you are looking for a good jean jacket and don't mind not having pockets for your hands.

reviewText: Perfect fit! Great style and arrived in 2 days!
Ordered a US MEDIUM and it perfectly fits.

This jacket by Mrignt is officially my new favorite article of clothing. It really is an awesome piece to wear this fall season! I am 5'7, 160 lbs, with a muscular frame (~ 8-10% body fat), and I went with a Medium in the "blue" color. I normally wear a small in outerwear for a more tailored look, but this jacket fit me PERFECTLY. An important thing to take note of, is this jacket is tailored to an asian frame. Asian men on average have smaller frames, so I would HIGHLY recommend ordering one size up from the size your normally order, unless of course you have a very thin frame.
I took some measurements to hopefully clear up any confusion, please refer to my pictures for this. Keep in mind when viewing these pictures that I ordered a Medium, which equates to an XXL in asian sizing.

Some individual's have stated that the buttons on this jacket make a lot of noise. While this is true, this only happens if the jacket is unbuttoned. Once the jacket is buttoned up, they do not move or make noise. The hood on this jacket comes off, however, I think it looks better on. The jacket has kept me very warm on these crisp fall days, and I definitely think it will do the same for you! Just make sure you read the sizing information carefully!

I received this product to test in exchange for an honest review. As someone who uses customer reviews to guide my own purchases, I take reviewing products seriously. Please know that my rating of this product was in no way biased.
summary: My new favorite jacket! However, PLEASE read sizing Info!

reviewText: Looks better in the picture and was too small, especially in the shoulders. They said 5x would be same as 2X Large in US. Not true

I followed the suggestions and for the 5XL and it fits like an XL. I'm 5'5" and a 40D chest and it got well enough that I could snuggle fit buttoned up- not that I plan on actually buttoning the jacket closed. The front buttons are cheap and jingle when unbuttoned - it would have been moved if they were snap buttons then, so they wouldn't make noise. They are also a bit tight to push through the button hole but I'm not worried about that - keeps the jacket securely shut if you plan on it staying put. The hood is detachable which is interesting - looks way better with the hood on. The Jean is good quality and so is the jersey hood and sleeves.

I'd give 5 stars if the front buttons were better quality and if it had pockets. Other than that, pretty nice jacket!

Bought to put phone in while walking.  Use like a fanny pack that is not bulky and ugly.

I received this product free of charge in exchange for my honest review. It was shipped on time and inside a yellow packaging envelope, simple and efficient which I appreciate. As for the product itself, it's basically like a fanny pack but much flatter and way more subtle; it's pretty much unnoticeable under your clothes. There are 2 pockets and both have a zipper so you can keep your cash in one and cards in the other. There is also an adjustable strap and the belt is secured with a plastic side buckle that remained fastened and was comfortable and stayed flat all day when I was wearing it, so no issues there. This would definitely come in handy when I'm traveling or going for a jog at night (particularly good for those of you who live in the city or an unsafe area) and don't want to worry about having to hold my wallet or a purse. I'll have to use it longer to see how durable it is over time but so far it does what it's supposed to and I have no complaints.
summary: Solid product, does what it intends to do.

reviewText:
** Item received in exchange for testing and review **

I got this money belt to replace an old one that I've been using for about 10 years. I ordered a few different designs but none of them were very comfortable next to my skin. This one is the winner, I personally like the fabric backing rather than a mesh backing, and this one feels sort of like a silky camisole rather than the more structured canvas that many of these belts are made from. I also like the rounded corners.

It's large enough to comfortably hold 2 passports, cash, and a small pouch with a few credit cards without feeling at all stuffed or bulky. The 2 section design is nice, it keeps things organized without having so many compartments that I forget where I put things.

The pouch also has an open area in the back where the belt can be tucked in so it's not just dangling and in the way when you're not wearing it.

It seems to be well made with nice stitching, the elastic is good without being too stretchy. I think that especially for women, this design is a real winner.

The shipping was very fast.  Package was neat and clean. The waist trainer was tight at first as I expected but once I got it on I was comfortable. Wore it for more than 12 hrs and was still comfortable.

I have been wanting a waist trainer for quite some time now. I have two children, both born by csection and a bit of a soda addiction so losing those last few pounds and inches seems damn near impossible! Of course ladies, we all wish we could work out and eat right don't we? Well, maybe anyway lol. Why cant it just be easy?? Why cant our bellies look small under those tighter fitting clothes?? This waist trainer is the answer to those prayers! I received this and I have to admit, as I first was putting it on, I got a bit scared. This bad boy was tight as heck! After laying down, sucking it in, holding my breath and finally succoming to asking my husband for help, I got this thing on. But would I be able to get back up? Yep! I got up and I actually felt good! It was tight, sure, but a good tight. A "damn I'm looking good and this bad boy is keeping all this love chunk tucked away" tight. I put it to the test and put on a form fitting dress and if I do say so myself, I looked damn good lol. My husband, thank goodness for this man, told me that I looked sexy (although the man also thought that the waist trainer was an outfit in itself and I wasn't supposed to wear anything else but hey, a man can dream cant he? Love this thing and cant wait to see long term results!

Disclosure: I received this product at a free/discounted price in exchange for my honest review.
summary: Great, quality alternative to the expensive waist trainers onthe market!

reviewText: I love how stylish these Freyrs sunglasses are. I ordered them in black and silver. They arrived in perfect condition, the packaging was a small sturdy box and the glasses came with a black cinch bag. They are very simple and light weight but still very sleek and stylish. I agree with other reviews and think they should be a little cheaper. In all, I really like the look of these glasses but I believe customers would purchase more at a better price. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These are pretty stylish sunglasses. They are rounder framed than traditional aviators, and have a more rounded nose piece as well. But, they do have a sleek look, the color is great, and they are not overly dark..just perfect for the average wear day or for driving.

I actually ordered these for my son to try, who is an adult with a larger head..they do not work for someone with a large head. These also didn't work on my husband. But for a woman or a teen with a smaller head, they fit just right. They are also lightweight , which I really love. The frame does not seem super sturdy, so I would use these only in activities where there would not be a chance of breakage.

I received this product for review and evaluation purposes. All opinions are my own and in no way influenced by the seller of this item. If my experience with this item changes over time, I will update this review. Thanks for reading!
summary: Stylish and sleek, but not for larger heads!

Im in my second pregnancy, I didn't use a flexible belly ring during my first pregnancy and thought  I would try this time, even though I don't have pain or any stretch marks. That being said this thing is not flexible at all and it being longer than a regular metal ring, it catches on everything and pulls which hurts.  The only time Ive had this much pain in my belly button was 11 years ago when I got it pierced and it was healing/infected. The part where the feet attached to the ring would also catch on things and/or would push into my stomach which was kind of sharp (even in my preggo pants). On top of everything else this is like the least flexible rubber Ive ever felt. I wish I hadnt wasted the $7, this product was a big fat fail.

It worked great at first but once I turned 7 months it started to hurt so I had to take it out. Bend it before putting it in your belly ring hole, that way it won't just be straight. The paint did chip off after a few showers.

reviewText: Smaller than I thought.

Awesome for displaying jewelry.

I have a jewelry box and I just wanted something nice to display a bulky necklace and this is excellent.

Decent size. Big enough to fit most lengths of the necklaces I own.

Very soft velvet! Definitely helps prevent necklaces from slipping down.

The base isn't heavy so putting a heavy necklace could cause it to tip over (I actually haven't used a necklace that heavy to cause this but just as an example)

The neck part sticks out a little bit not much but enough for most necklaces.

Honestly, this is like what you see at a Zales or Kay Jewelers. Same quality. Looks elegant. Well made and excellent for displaying various styles of necklaces.

My ONLY complaint is the base was a little dirty. Not a big issue because is a base...no one is going to ignore the jewelry and turn it over to make sure the base is clean. That is just me being picky.

No elegant packaging either like a box, again I'm being picky because a display like this (but not as nice) from a craft store will also not come in a box.

I love it. Makes me feel fancy displaying my jewelry like a jewelry store.

Sample provided by Ginasy Accessory for my evaluation and honest review.

I have been on the hunt for cute, fun, comfortable boyshorts for a while, due to their full coverage, and (typically) their ability to be worn under more form fitting clothing (i.e. leggings). Based on popular reviews, I decided to order these, and was rather disappointed with what I received.

Pros:

Cute, fun designs
Wide waistband (preferred for me, maybe be different for others)
Soft

Cons:

Thin
Ripped on inside (see photos)
Small (despite stretching out)
Easily snagged
Does not stay in place
Rides up
Line around the legs

First the pros. The design was really really cool. Im not one that typically cares about designs on underwear (who really sees it, anyway), but the moment I took it out of the package, I fell in love with the design. The wider waistband was a plus, for me anyways, as it is a reassuring factor.  The texture was really nice and sift, as well, being mostly nylon, I was expecting this, anyways.

The cons. Let it be known that, for the price, I was not expecting high quality clothing, but based on the reviews, I had higher hopes, thinking maybe the reviews were just a few lemons. Right after noticing the cute design and waistband, I noticed the thin material. It is very very thin, and that raised a red flag for me immediately. When I went to try them on, is when I noticed the snags you see in the photos. Thinking maybe I did this when I started to put them on, I examined the other ones. All have the similar snag and pulls in it as the first.  All of which, mind you, looks like runs in nylons themselves, for those that recognize that. Furthermore, my fingers were catching in the fabric as I was attempting to put them on, just like a pair of nylons would. Important to note, I have bras that are made with 92% nylon (2% more in these underwear), and this is not an issue with those.

The size was an issue, as well. Granted, it does state one size fits most, but with 34 hips, I was surprised and how snug they were. And, of course, with that, came the fact that they were riding up, and giving free wedgies. For those that may wear pantyliners (whether frequently or infrequently), the riding up of these underwear forced these liners, into, otherwise unpleasant places and at odd angles. Important to note, which is not listed under the description, is that the lining of these underwear were not cotton.

Another issue was the label that said seamless. There is definitely a seam, which is around the legs of these, that is quite thick, and not something that could be missed under form fitting clothing.

Overall, despite the soft material, colorful design and wider waistband, the snagged material, snug fit, causing riding into places unknown, will have me returning these, and looking elsewhere.

They fit as expected and are comfortable. The legs roll up on me but it isn't that much of an inconvenience.

summary: They fit as expected and are comfortable. The legs roll up on me but it ...
